alert.note: Alert for Grand (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 16 at 3:24PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Colorado... Colorado River near CO-UT State Line affecting Grand and Mesa Counties. .The combination of warm, spring temperatures and the potential for periods of heavy rain falling on a deep snowpack upstream will lead to an increase in runoff from snowmelt. Flows in rivers will continue to increase through the end of the week. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Colorado River near CO-UT State Line. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...expect minor low-land flooding between the confluence with the Gunnison River and the CO-UT State Line, including inundated sections of the Riverside Front Trail. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM MDT Tuesday the stage was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 13.6 feet late Saturday morning. - Action stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Colorado River CO-UT State Lin 15.0 11.6 Tue 2 pm MDT 12.2 12.8 13.4 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks, and please heed all trail and roadway closures. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
